alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pocahontas, Nicholas, southern Braxton, Webster, Clay and central Fayette Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms near Gauley Bridge, or 10 miles north of Fayetteville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Clay, Babcock State Park, Webster Springs, Oak Hill, Ansted, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Hawks Nest State Park, Birch River, Craigsville, Big Otter, Camden On Gauley, Wallback, Harrison, Cowen and Thurmond. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 34 and 41. Route 19 between mile markers 15 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, southeastern and north central West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas
